trans-unit.source: Date / Time Map Operations - Usage and Examples
trans-unit.target: Date / Time Map Operations - Usage and Examples

trans-unit.source: Lists the Date/Time <token>mapop</token>s in <token>af_integration_full</token>.
trans-unit.target: Lists the Date/Time <token>mapop</token>s in <token>af_integration_full</token>.

trans-unit.source: Date/Time <token>mapop</token>s
trans-unit.target: Date/Time <token>mapop</token>s

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Parameters
trans-unit.target: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Output
trans-unit.target: Output

trans-unit.source: DateTime Reformat
trans-unit.target: DateTime Reformat

trans-unit.source: Reformats a date/time value.
trans-unit.target: Reformats a date/time value.

trans-unit.source: Requires exactly one input parameter:
trans-unit.target: Requires exactly one input parameter:

trans-unit.source: Input
trans-unit.target: Input

trans-unit.source: A link from a tree node.
trans-unit.target: A link from a tree node.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Input Format</embeddedLabel>, specify the appropriate format.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Input Format</embeddedLabel>, specify the appropriate format.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Output Format</embeddedLabel>, specify the desired output format.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Output Format</embeddedLabel>, specify the desired output format.

trans-unit.source: The incoming date/time value will be formatted to the new output format.
trans-unit.target: The incoming date/time value will be formatted to the new output format.

trans-unit.source: Generate Date Time
trans-unit.target: Generate Date Time

trans-unit.source: Generates the current Date/Time.
trans-unit.target: Generates the current Date/Time.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Output Format</embeddedLabel>, specify the desired format.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Output Format</embeddedLabel>, specify the desired format.

trans-unit.source: The incoming value is generated using the Date/Time format specified.
trans-unit.target: The incoming value is generated using the Date/Time format specified.

trans-unit.source: Adjust TimeZone
trans-unit.target: Adjust TimeZone

trans-unit.source: Converts a date/time value to a different time zone.
trans-unit.target: Converts a date/time value to a different time zone.

trans-unit.source: An Input Date is parsed and then converted from the Input time zone to the Output time zone.
trans-unit.target: An Input Date is parsed and then converted from the Input time zone to the Output time zone.

trans-unit.source: Some key points:
trans-unit.target: Some key points:

trans-unit.source: When only a date is specified for <ui>Input Date</ui>, 12AM is used for the time.
trans-unit.target: When only a date is specified for <ui>Input Date</ui>, 12AM is used for the time.

trans-unit.source: When the Input Date value contains the "K" format, the <ui>Input TimeZone</ui> option is grayed out.
trans-unit.target: When the Input Date value contains the "K" format, the <ui>Input TimeZone</ui> option is grayed out.

trans-unit.source: At runtime, the Input Time Zone is extracted from the Input Date value.
trans-unit.target: At runtime, the Input Time Zone is extracted from the Input Date value.

trans-unit.source: If Input Date is not present, UTC is used.
trans-unit.target: If Input Date is not present, UTC is used.

trans-unit.source: Requires exactly one input parameter:
trans-unit.target: Requires exactly one input parameter:

trans-unit.source: Input Date
trans-unit.target: Input Date

trans-unit.source: A link from a tree node or an entered date value.
trans-unit.target: A link from a tree node or an entered date value.

trans-unit.source: Also specify the following:
trans-unit.target: Also specify the following:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Input Format</embeddedLabel>: Select a Date/Time format of the Input Date specified.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Input Format</embeddedLabel>: Select a Date/Time format of the Input Date specified.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Input TimeZone</embeddedLabel>:
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Input TimeZone</embeddedLabel>:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Output TimeZone</embeddedLabel>:
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Output TimeZone</embeddedLabel>:

trans-unit.source: The incoming Date value is converted to the Output time zone.
trans-unit.target: The incoming Date value is converted to the Output time zone.

trans-unit.source: Known Issue
trans-unit.target: Known Issue

trans-unit.source: When a DateTime Reformat <token>mapop</token> is added to the design area and configured, the <embeddedLabel>Format</embeddedLabel> drop-down list may be grayed out.
trans-unit.target: When a DateTime Reformat <token>mapop</token> is added to the design area and configured, the <embeddedLabel>Format</embeddedLabel> drop-down list may be grayed out.

trans-unit.source: This can happen if the computer Display is set <embeddedLabel>Medium – 125%</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Larger – 150%</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: This can happen if the computer Display is set <embeddedLabel>Medium – 125%</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Larger – 150%</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: To resolve, set the display to <legacyBold>Smaller – 100% (default)</legacyBold> using the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To resolve, set the display to <legacyBold>Smaller – 100% (default)</legacyBold> using the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Open the <embeddedLabel>Control Panel</embeddedLabel> and select <embeddedLabel>Appearance and Personalization</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Open the <embeddedLabel>Control Panel</embeddedLabel> and select <embeddedLabel>Appearance and Personalization</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Display</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Display</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select <legacyBold>Smaller – 100% (default)</legacyBold> and select <embeddedLabel>Apply</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <legacyBold>Smaller – 100% (default)</legacyBold> and select <embeddedLabel>Apply</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The Format drop-down list should now work as expected.
trans-unit.target: The Format drop-down list should now work as expected.

trans-unit.source: Error and Data Handling
trans-unit.target: Error and Data Handling

trans-unit.source: <token>af_integration</token> provides the ability to configure how an error is handled and how an empty or null node is handled.
trans-unit.target: <token>af_integration</token> provides the ability to configure how an error is handled and how an empty or null node is handled.

trans-unit.source: The error handling behavior of <ui>Date / Time</ui> is configurable in a <ui><token>msgflow_proj</token></ui> and the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> project.
trans-unit.target: The error handling behavior of <ui>Date / Time</ui> is configurable in a <ui><token>msgflow_proj</token></ui> and the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> project.

trans-unit.source: Steps:
trans-unit.target: Steps:

trans-unit.source: Open a <ui><token>msgflow_proj</token></ui> or a <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> project in <token>vsprvs</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open a <ui><token>msgflow_proj</token></ui> or a <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> project in <token>vsprvs</token>.

trans-unit.source: Double-click a <token>transform</token> (.trfm) to open the <token>transform</token> Designer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click a <token>transform</token> (.trfm) to open the <token>transform</token> Designer.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>transform</token> toolbar, select <ui>Settings</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>transform</token> toolbar, select <ui>Settings</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Error Handling</ui> tab
trans-unit.target: <ui>Error Handling</ui> tab

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Error Handling</ui> tab, <ui>Date / Time Operations</ui> have two <ui>Behavior</ui> options:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Error Handling</ui> tab, <ui>Date / Time Operations</ui> have two <ui>Behavior</ui> options:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Fail map</ui>: The entire <token>transform</token> is aborted.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Fail map</ui>: The entire <token>transform</token> is aborted.

trans-unit.source: Since <token>transform</token>s are executed within a pipeline, an error occurs within the pipeline and is then sent to the user who sent the message.
trans-unit.target: Since <token>transform</token>s are executed within a pipeline, an error occurs within the pipeline and is then sent to the user who sent the message.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Output default value Null</ui>: A null value is returned as the output.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Output default value Null</ui>: A null value is returned as the output.

trans-unit.source: A null value behaves as an empty value behaves <legacyItalic>except</legacyItalic> when sorting a List.
trans-unit.target: A null value behaves as an empty value behaves <legacyItalic>except</legacyItalic> when sorting a List.

trans-unit.source: When sorting a List, null values are considered less than empty values.
trans-unit.target: When sorting a List, null values are considered less than empty values.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Null/Empty Data Handling</ui> tab
trans-unit.target: <ui>Null/Empty Data Handling</ui> tab

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Null/Empty Data Handling</ui> tab, there are three options:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Null/Empty Data Handling</ui> tab, there are three options:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Consider empty nodes in cumulative operations</ui>: By default, this is not checked.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Consider empty nodes in cumulative operations</ui>: By default, this is not checked.

trans-unit.source: When not checked, no empty nodes are included in the iteration.
trans-unit.target: When not checked, no empty nodes are included in the iteration.

trans-unit.source: When checked, all nodes, including empty nodes, are included in the iteration.
trans-unit.target: When checked, all nodes, including empty nodes, are included in the iteration.

trans-unit.source: EXAMPLE: There is a document with 10 <record> nodes.
trans-unit.target: EXAMPLE: There is a document with 10 <record> nodes.

trans-unit.source: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.
trans-unit.target: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is not checked, the <token>mapop</token> returns a value of seven.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is not checked, the <token>mapop</token> returns a value of seven.

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> returns a value of 10.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> returns a value of 10.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui>: By default, this is not checked.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui>: By default, this is not checked.

trans-unit.source: When not checked, no empty nodes are included in the iteration.
trans-unit.target: When not checked, no empty nodes are included in the iteration.

trans-unit.source: When checked, all nodes, including empty nodes, are included in the iteration.
trans-unit.target: When checked, all nodes, including empty nodes, are included in the iteration.

trans-unit.source: EXAMPLE: there is a document with 10 <record> nodes.
trans-unit.target: EXAMPLE: there is a document with 10 <record> nodes.

trans-unit.source: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.
trans-unit.target: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is not checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates seven times for the non-empty nodes.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is not checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates seven times for the non-empty nodes.

trans-unit.source: As a result, seven <record> nodes are generated in the Target.
trans-unit.target: As a result, seven <record> nodes are generated in the Target.

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates 10 times for all nodes, including the empty nodes.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates 10 times for all nodes, including the empty nodes.

trans-unit.source: As a result, 10 <record> nodes are generated in the Target.
trans-unit.target: As a result, 10 <record> nodes are generated in the Target.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Target Node Generation</ui>: If empty nodes are configured to be considered, you choose to generate an empty node in the output or to not generate an empty node in the output.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Target Node Generation</ui>: If empty nodes are configured to be considered, you choose to generate an empty node in the output or to not generate an empty node in the output.

trans-unit.source: Specifically:
trans-unit.target: Specifically:

trans-unit.source: Do not generate empty nodes: Default option.
trans-unit.target: Do not generate empty nodes: Default option.

trans-unit.source: Generate empty nodes
trans-unit.target: Generate empty nodes

trans-unit.source: EXAMPLE: There is a document with 10 <record> nodes.
trans-unit.target: EXAMPLE: There is a document with 10 <record> nodes.

trans-unit.source: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.
trans-unit.target: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Consider empty nodes in cumulative operations</ui> or <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> are not checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates seven times for the non-empty nodes.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Consider empty nodes in cumulative operations</ui> or <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> are not checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates seven times for the non-empty nodes.

trans-unit.source: As a result, seven <record> nodes are generated in the Target.
trans-unit.target: As a result, seven <record> nodes are generated in the Target.

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates 10 times for all nodes, including the empty nodes.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates 10 times for all nodes, including the empty nodes.

trans-unit.source: As a result, 10 <record> nodes are generated in the Target.
trans-unit.target: As a result, 10 <record> nodes are generated in the Target.

trans-unit.source: Additional <token>mapop</token>s
trans-unit.target: Additional <token>mapop</token>s
